titleInfo.title: Letter from Ephraim Gerrish Stannus, Resident at Bushire, to Bashere bin Rahma

physicalDescription.extent: Foliation: This item has two different foliation sequences. The first is part of an original foliation sequence which was applied to the whole volume. It is written in ink and appears at the top right (recto) or top left (verso) corner of the folio. The second foliation number is a small pencil number enclosed in a circle which also appears in the top right corner (recto) only, this is the foliation number that has been used in referencing this item.Condition: The item has suffered from insect damage and is difficult to read in places as parts of the text are missing.

mods.abstract: This letter responds to a note from Bashere bin Rahma and states that Stannus has no wish to see his father overwhelmed by his enemies, nor has the power to take steps against either party. It outlines the steps Stannus took to check violent proceedings against the people of Katiffe [Al-Qaṭīf] and Bahrein [Bahrain] Kovcet and other Neutrals whilst awaiting orders from India, that subsequently ordered him to remove two ships sent to Damon and abstain from all interference between Rahma and the Shaikhs of Bahrain and Katiffe.
